alert.note: Alert for San Juan River Basin; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:08PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Archuleta County through 245 PM MDT... At 208 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Pagosa Springs, or 24 miles northwest of Dulce, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Archuleta County, including the following locations... Chimney Rock, Pagosa Junction and Lonetree. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 84 in Colorado between mile markers 20 and 27. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 115 and 145. Colorado 151 between mile markers 22 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: San Juan River Basin; Southwest San Juan Mountains
